definition: (of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

sentences.english: However, not all people infected with TB bacilli will become sick.
sentences.chinese: 但是，感染結核桿菌的人不一定患病。

sentences.english: The disease is considered to be active as long as tubercle bacilli have been detected in the sputum.
sentences.chinese: 只要痰中檢出結核桿菌，就應考慮本病處於活動期。

sentences.english: A person needs only to inhale a small number of these to be infected.
sentences.chinese: 一個人只需要吸入少量結核桿菌，就可染病。

sentences.english: Overall, one-third of the world's population is currently infected with the TB bacillus.
sentences.chinese: 總體上，世界三分之一的人口目前已感染結核桿菌。

sentences.english: People ill with TB bacteria in their lungs can infect others when they cough.
sentences.chinese: 肺部感染結核桿菌的患者在咳嗽時可能傳染他人。

sentences.english: Alleles C of position -69 possibly play a role in preventing tuberculosis.
sentences.chinese: 等位基因C可能有阻止結核桿菌感染的作用。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the application value of protein chip technology in the detection of the anti mycobacterium tuberculosis antibody.
sentences.chinese: 目的評價蛋白芯片技術檢測結核桿菌抗體的應用價值。

sentences.english: But people infected with TB bacilli will not necessarily become sick with the disease.
sentences.chinese: 但是，感染結核桿菌的人不一定患病。

sentences.english: Overall, one third of the world's population is currently infected with TB.
sentences.chinese: 目前，世界上總共有三分之一的人口已感染結核桿菌。

sentences.english: Methods TB was detected by smearing directly or smearing of concentrated sputum and by sputum culturing.
sentences.chinese: 痰中結核桿菌的檢測方法常規採用痰塗片及痰培養。

sentences.english: Someone in the world is newly infected with TB bacilli every second.
sentences.chinese: 世界上每秒鐘就有一人新感染結核桿菌。

sentences.english: The strong household clustering of MTI suggests that family sources of exposure are important.
sentences.chinese: 結核桿菌感染的強家庭聚集性表明家庭暴露源很重要。

pinyin: you1 men2 luo2 xuan2 gan3 jun1

definition: choroid (vascular layer of the eyeball between the retina and the sclera)
thyroid hormone/thyroxine (used to treat underactive thyroid)
histamine (a biogenic amine involved in local immune responses)
